solution_line_template: The vending machine has been used {total_uses} times, so it has failed to drop a snack {total_uses} / {fail_frequency_denominator} = <<{total_uses}/{fail_frequency_denominator}={failed_drops}>>{failed_drops} times.
The vending machine has dropped 2 snacks {total_uses} / {double_drop_frequency_denominator} = <<{total_uses}/{double_drop_frequency_denominator}={double_drops}>>{double_drops} times.
It has operated normally and dropped 1 snack {total_uses} - {failed_drops} - {double_drops} = <<{total_uses}-{failed_drops}-{double_drops}={normal_drops}>>{normal_drops} times.

Thus, the vending machine has dropped {normal_drops} + {double_drops} * {snacks_per_double_drop} = {normal_drops} + {double_drops_times_two} = <<{normal_drops}+{double_drops}*{snacks_per_double_drop}={total_snacks_dropped}>>{total_snacks_dropped} snacks in thirty uses.
